key_points: Allen Cheney, 'Rust' executive producer, defends his and Emily Salveson's involvement in the production, stating their roles were limited to financial backing.
Cheney's statement addresses IATSE's criticism regarding the hiring of a non-union crew following a walkout.
Cheney asserts 'Rust' is union-certified and in good standing with major production unions including IATSE, the Teamsters, SAG, and DGA.
The tragic shooting on the 'Rust' set led to the death of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins and injury of director Joel Souza.
Assistant director Dave Halls handed Alec Baldwin the weapon that caused the accident, believing it to be safe.
Los Angeles City Councilman Paul Koretz emphasizes the permanent damage caused by accidents on movie sets.
Legal commentator Nancy Grace suggests Alec Baldwin could face charges of negligent homicide.
The production of 'Rust' has been halted pending police investigation.
The incident has sparked a conversation about safety protocols on film sets.
Newsweek attempted to reach Allen Cheney for further comment.
